subject: About
description: As the 1800s rolled into the 1900s, the economy of the Lower Rio Grande Valley was changing from traditional ranching to commercialized agriculture, setting the stage for unprecedented growth.  [1]  With its key location in the center of the Valley, the town of Mercedes became the hub of this transition. Advanced irrigation and canal systems were first built in Mercedes. Mercedes had its own power plant, and was the first Valley town to have electric lighting.  Mercedes was the site of military camps during the Border War and World War I.
